abstract: Milan Chapman receives funds from Community Service Society of New York for purchase of monthly MetroCards that will allow her to attend job training programs; society is one of seven agencies supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.
lead_paragraph: Milan Chapman wound up on the streets at a young age when her mother kicked her out of her home. Years later, a new career is expanding her future.

headline.main: After Homelessness and Jail, a Harlem Woman Finds Stability Working Construction
headline.print_headline: After Homelessness and Jail, Finding Stability in a New Career

snippet: Milan Chapman wound up on the streets at a young age when her mother kicked her out of her home. Years later, a new career is expanding her future.
